column3: Faculty of Management, Economics and Social Sciences
column5: The Double Master's Programme in Economics gives you the opportunity to benefit from the expertise of two top universities. You spend one year studying at each university and graduate with two master's degrees: a Master of Science in Economics awarded by the University of Cologne and a Master of Arts in Economics awarded by Keio University in Tokyo, Japan.
column7: In Cologne there are no tuition fees, just a biannual social contribution fee of slightly more than 300 euros. For the studies at Keio University, students are exempted from paying tuition fees. Invest in an excellent education and your future without paying a fortune.
